column1: Operation Warp Speed is getting the job done. Pfizer today announced their vaccine candidate is more than 90% effective in preventing people from contracting COVID-19.   https://t.co/vqG3hKGl7B
Covid has taken a toll in this nation but it has disproportionately affected poorer countries like Nicaragua and Haiti where I have worked. Please keep them in your prayers. https://t.co/Bhz7Y9d0VS

When it comes down to it the facts show the COVID-19 vaccine developed through #OperationWarpSpeed will be safe AND effective. Unemployment expires tonight. Republicans offered to extend benefits for a week while Congress gets its act together to pass a more comprehensive bill.  Dems blocked it bc they'd rather pass their socialist agenda instead of help Americans who are out of work due to COVID.

The science and data point toward reopening schools. The risk to healthy children under 18 is exceedingly low - much less than the flu or other childhood dangers.  Watch my latest COVID update below. https://t.co/FfdvADm6nN

3 takeaways in my latest COVID-19 update:  -COVID-19 is more dangerous than flu bc we don't have a vaccine yet  -Numbers are going up so fast bc we're testing more people  -Everyone needs to take personal responsibility by washing hands avoiding areas of high exposure etc. https://t.co/wBJJ9b0kbx

Again folks there is no reason for panic over COVID-19. Concern? Yes. Panic? No. Numbers of individuals testing positive is because testing is now increasing. As we see more testing positive the mortality rate decreases as most infected have only mild symptoms.

I wanted to provide people with an update on coronavirus from the perspective of a physician. Takeaways: -Containment is over it’s time for mitigation. -Not a time to panic. Education is the key.  -Practice good hand washing habits. https://t.co/MgsjKtA6VU

President @realDonaldTrump has rightly requested Congress provide $2.5B to protect Americans from coronavirus. As a physician I understand the gravity of this situation and hope Congress will move quickly to ensure we are prepared to take on this outbreak if necessary.
